sections.title: Implementations
sections.content:
Implementations

 InherentImplementation ::=
 $$impl$$ GenericParameterList? ImplementingType WhereClause? ImplementationBody

 TraitImplementation ::=
 $$unsafe$$? $$impl$$ GenericParameterList? $$!$$? ImplementedTrait $$for$$ ImplementingType WhereClause? ImplementationBody

 ImplementingType ::=
 TypeSpecification

 ImplementedTrait ::=
 TypePath

 ImplementationBody ::=
 $${$$
 InnerAttributeOrDoc*
 AssociatedItem*
 $$}$$

An implementation is an item that supplements an
implementing type by extending its functionality.

An implementing type is the type that the [associated item]s of
an implementation are associated with.

Within an implementation, the type Self acts as a type alias
for the implementing type.

An implementation body is a construct that encapsulates the
[associated item]s, [inner attribute]s, and
[inner doc comment]s of an implementation.

An inherent implementation is an implementation that adds direct
functionality.

[Inherent implementation]s of the same implementing type shall be
defined within the same crate.

A trait implementation is an implementation that adds functionality
specified by a trait.

An unsafe trait implementation is a trait implementation subject to
keyword unsafe.

An implemented trait is a trait whose functionality has been
implemented by an implementing type.

The type path of a trait implementation shall resolve to a trait.

A trait implementation shall be an unsafe trait implementation if and
only if it implements an unsafe trait.

[Trait implementation]s are subject to implementation coherence and
implementation conformance.

[Inherent implementation]s of the same implementing type shall not
define more than one associated item with the same name in the same
namespace.

Circle is an implementing type.

The following is an inherent implementation:

The following is a trait implementation:

paragraphs.fls_ivxpoxggy7s6: An implementation is an item that supplements an implementing type by extending its functionality.
paragraphs.fls_yopmjbnw8tbl: An implementing type is the type that the [associated item]s of an implementation are associated with.
paragraphs.fls_eIHc8Y9fBtr0: Within an implementation, the type Self acts as a type alias for the implementing type.
paragraphs.fls_Mcpdzzcw43M7: An implementation body is a construct that encapsulates the [associated item]s, [inner attribute]s, and [inner doc comment]s of an implementation.
paragraphs.fls_v0n0bna40dqr: An inherent implementation is an implementation that adds direct functionality.
paragraphs.fls_797etpdk5dyb: [Inherent implementation]s of the same implementing type shall be defined within the same crate.
paragraphs.fls_ry3an0mwb63g: A trait implementation is an implementation that adds functionality specified by a trait.
paragraphs.fls_8pwr7ibvhmhu: An unsafe trait implementation is a trait implementation subject to keyword unsafe.
paragraphs.fls_47x0ep8of8wr: An implemented trait is a trait whose functionality has been implemented by an implementing type.
paragraphs.fls_agitlryvyc16: The type path of a trait implementation shall resolve to a trait.
paragraphs.fls_mx5xjcejwa6u: A trait implementation shall be an unsafe trait implementation if and only if it implements an unsafe trait.
paragraphs.fls_z78dg261oob6: [Trait implementation]s are subject to implementation coherence and implementation conformance.
paragraphs.fls_89yNjGNB7KI3: [Inherent implementation]s of the same implementing type shall not define more than one associated item with the same name in the same namespace.

paragraphs.fls_yuyesijndu9n: Circle is an implementing type. .. code-block:: rust struct Circle { radius: f64 }
paragraphs.fls_o62i75sjzp9y: The following is an inherent implementation: .. code-block:: rust impl Circle { fn set_radius(mut self, new_radius: f64) { self.radius = new_radius; } }
paragraphs.fls_a2utf0tmuhy4: The following is a trait implementation: .. code-block:: rust impl Shape for Circle { fn area(self) -> f64 { self.radius.powi(2) * std::f64::consts::PI } }

paragraphs.syntax_1:
Implementation ::=
       InherentImplementation
     | TraitImplementation

   InherentImplementation ::=
       $$impl$$ GenericParameterList? ImplementingType WhereClause? ImplementationBody

   TraitImplementation ::=
       $$unsafe$$? $$impl$$ GenericParameterList? $$!$$? ImplementedTrait $$for$$ ImplementingType WhereClause? ImplementationBody

   ImplementingType ::=
       TypeSpecification

   ImplementedTrait ::=
       TypePath

   ImplementationBody ::=
       $${$$
         InnerAt...

sections.title: Implementation Coherence
sections.content:
Implementation Coherence

A trait implementation exhibits implementation coherence when it is
valid and does not overlap with another trait implementation.

Two [trait implementation]s of the same implemented trait overlap when
the intersection of the [implementing type]s is non-empty.

Given trait implementation
impl<P1, P2, .., PN> Trait<T1, T2, .., TN> for T0, the
trait implementation is considered valid when

* Trait is fundamental or a local trait, or

* All of

 * At least one of [type]s T0, T1, .., TN is :T:`fundamental` or a
 local type, and

 * No type parameter of P1, P2, .., PN that is not used in another
 type may appear in the non-[local type]s and
 non-[fundamental] [type]s of T0, T1, .., TN.

A trait or type is fundamental when its
implementation coherence rules are relaxed and the trait or type
is always treated as if it was a local trait or a local type.

The following [type]s are fundamental:

* [reference type]s

* core::pin::Pin

..
 also `alloc::boxed::Box`

The following [trait]s are fundamental:

* core::ops::Fn

* core::ops::FnMut

* core::ops::FnOnce

* core::marker::Sized

A trait implementation shall be coherent.

paragraphs.fls_fv1l4yjuut7p: A trait implementation exhibits implementation coherence when it is valid and does not overlap with another trait implementation.
paragraphs.fls_swdusjwzgksx: Two [trait implementation]s of the same implemented trait overlap when the intersection of the [implementing type]s is non-empty.
paragraphs.fls_ir7hp941ky8t: Given trait implementation impl<P1, P2, .., PN> Trait<T1, T2, .., TN> for T0, the trait implementation is considered valid when
paragraphs.fls_3tbm20k2ixol: Trait is fundamental or a local trait, or
paragraphs.fls_9klwbsh3vlxu: At least one of [type]s T0, T1, .., TN is :T:fundamental or a local type, and
paragraphs.fls_9gmc1tcscq9v: No type parameter of P1, P2, .., PN that is not used in another type may appear in the non-[local type]s and non-[fundamental] [type]s of T0, T1, .., TN.
paragraphs.fls_UkQhjEWSJpDq: A trait or type is fundamental when its implementation coherence rules are relaxed and the trait or type is always treated as if it was a local trait or a local type.
paragraphs.fls_koy70k770ayu: A trait implementation shall be coherent.

sections.title: Implementation Conformance
sections.content:
Implementation Conformance

A trait implementation exhibits implementation conformance when it
satisfies the constraints of its implemented trait.

An associated trait constant is conformant with an associated constant
of an implemented trait when

* The [name]s of both [associated constant]s are the same, and

* The type of the associated constant in the implementation is a
 subtype of the type of the associated trait constant.

An associated trait function is conformant with an associated function
of an implemented trait when

* The function signature of the associated function of the
 implemented trait is a subtype of the function signature of
 the associated trait function, and

* The [bound]s of the associated function of the
 implemented trait are more general that the [bound]s of the
 associated trait function.

An associated type of a trait implementation is conformant with an
associated type of an implemented trait when

* The [name]s of both [type]s are the same, and

* The type specification of the associated type of the
 implemented trait conforms to the [bound]s of the
 associated type of the trait implementation.

A trait implementation is conformant with an implemented trait when:

* The trait implementation has a conformant associated constant
 for each associated constant of the implemented trait, unless the
 associated constant of the implemented trait has a default value,
 and

* The trait implementation has a conformant associated function
 for each associated function of the implemented trait, unless
 the associated function of the implemented trait has a default
 implementation in the implemented trait, and

* The trait implementation has a conformant associated type for each
 associated type of the implemented trait.

A trait implementation shall be conformant.

paragraphs.fls_YyUSuAYG4lX6: A trait implementation exhibits implementation conformance when it satisfies the constraints of its implemented trait.
paragraphs.fls_v31idwjau90d: An associated trait constant is conformant with an associated constant of an implemented trait when
paragraphs.fls_k3wfh5japmyw: The [name]s of both [associated constant]s are the same, and
paragraphs.fls_11qrqfuc3rmh: The type of the associated constant in the implementation is a subtype of the type of the associated trait constant.
paragraphs.fls_qmhduwunxww0: An associated trait function is conformant with an associated function of an implemented trait when
paragraphs.fls_2500ivh0cc3y: The function signature of the associated function of the implemented trait is a subtype of the function signature of the associated trait function, and
paragraphs.fls_18gimgfy0kw9: The [bound]s of the associated function of the implemented trait are more general that the [bound]s of the associated trait function.
paragraphs.fls_fi4qmauirlsm: An associated type of a trait implementation is conformant with an associated type of an implemented trait when
paragraphs.fls_2s8lh3k4rw6u: The [name]s of both [type]s are the same, and
paragraphs.fls_bb874uu2alt3: The type specification of the associated type of the implemented trait conforms to the [bound]s of the associated type of the trait implementation.
paragraphs.fls_so8em6rphkhv: A trait implementation is conformant with an implemented trait when:
paragraphs.fls_ldu9bmb9cy10: The trait implementation has a conformant associated constant for each associated constant of the implemented trait, unless the associated constant of the implemented trait has a default value, and
paragraphs.fls_5cr6un2gzdft: The trait implementation has a conformant associated function for each associated function of the implemented trait, unless the associated function of the implemented trait has a default implementation in the implemented trait, and
paragraphs.fls_pshfe3ioh0mg: The trait implementation has a conformant associated type for each associated type of the implemented trait.
paragraphs.fls_8yq1g7nzv9px: A trait implementation shall be conformant.
